item.title: FAQ Accordion
item.dc:creator: jessbudd
item.content:encoded:
How long will my website take?

A normal website takes 4-6 weeks from start to finish. Of course, your time timeline will depend on how prepared you are and how quickly you are able to respond at each stage with feedback. 

What do you build the website on?

My websites are predominately built on the most popular content management system in the world: WordPress.

I prefer to work with WordPress over other common platforms due to it's power, flexibility and robustness. 

What if need more than is listed in the packages?

No problem! I'm happy to provide a custom quote for any additional services you may need like booking systems, membership sites etc.

Just fill out the New Project Form and tell me what you're looking for.

How do I schedule a meeting with you?

I'm always happy to jump on a call to discuss your project. You can see my availability and book a time with me at calendly.com/fireflywebdesign/meeting.

How do I pay?

When you accept the project proposal you'll receive an invoice for a 50% deposit. This secures your booking with me and can be easily paid online with a credit card.

The balance payment is due when you approve the website, just before going live. 

Do you host the websites you design?

No, I do not host the websites myself. If your package includes hosting (or you add it on to your package) I will set up your domain and web hosting for you with one of my preferred providers. Otherwise, you'll need to purchase domain and hosting prior to the project starting. 

I just need help with my existing website

If you have a website you're mostly happy with, but need some help with fixes or updates I can help with that too. 

Just fill out my Support Form and I can prepare a quote based on my hourly rate.

item.title: Sales Page Template
item.dc:creator: jessbudd
item.content:encoded:
Get the website you deserve

  • Duplicate Widget
  • Save Widget
  • Remove Widget

Are you ready to level up your online presence?

Does this sound familiar...

  • You've spent months searching for the perfect WordPress theme, but still can't find exactly what you want?
  • You're wasting precious hours googling and youtubing tutorials to make simple changes to your site?
  • The thought of sending your dream client to your current website kind of makes you want to cringe?

It doesn't have to be like that.

There is a better way.

You CAN be super excited to show off your website.

You CAN stop stressing and get on with what you do best (your business!).

You CAN have that amazing vision from your head turned into reality.

That's what I'm here for.

A professional website shows you are a professional.

You're not just an entrepreneur. You're a creative business #boss that's worth investing in.

Show your clients you're the real deal, with a custom website that screams your products and services are worth it. Get more clients chasing YOU with a website tailored to convert visitors into customers.

Let me melt away that frustration you've been feeling and take care of building your online home.

 

  • Duplicate Widget
  • Save Widget
  • Remove Widget
Get your website sorted

"Jess is very easy to work with, always happy to answer questions and talk you through options as well as the how to once the website was set up. Responds quickly to emails, very well priced, and we are super stoked with our finished product!"

Cassie Riggio | Pinjarra Football & Netball Club

  • Duplicate Widget
  • Save Widget
  • Remove Widget

"Jess updated my website’s look and has done a fantastic job, communicated very well and worked quickly to deliver great results. My views are up, the feedback is great and my bounce rate decreased from 64% to 7%!”

Alison Harley | Lorelei Jayne

  • Duplicate Widget
  • Save Widget
  • Remove Widget

Websites should be as individual as you are and I'd love to work with you on coming up with a custom package.

That being said, sometimes it's nice to order straight off the menu. That's why I've created three packages you can choose from, if  you prefer.

Website Packages

  • Duplicate Widget
  • Save Widget
  • Remove Widget
  • Duplicate Widget
  • Save Widget
  • Remove Widget

The Starter Package

$ 895
  • Custom web design
  • Up to 5 web pages
  • Set up of blog
  • Social media integration
  • Security plugin
  • Two weeks email support
  • Set up of online shop
  • Newsletter intergration
  • Automated backups
  • Google analytics
  • Custom user manual
  • Domain & Hosting
  • Duplicate Widget
  • Save Widget
  • Remove Widget
  • Duplicate Widget
  • Save Widget
  • Remove Widget

The Entrepreneur Package

$ 1495
  • Custom web design
  • Up to 7 web pages
  • Set up of blog
  • Social media integration
  • Setup of online shop (up to 5 products)
  • Security plugin
  • Newsletter integration
  • Automated backups
  • One month email support
  • Google analytics
  • Domain & Hosting
  • Custom user manual
  • Duplicate Widget
  • Save Widget
  • Remove Widget
  • Duplicate Widget
  • Save Widget
  • Remove Widget

The Pro Package

$ 1950
  • Custom design
  • Up to 10 web pages
  • Set up of blog
  • Social media integration
  • Setup of online shop (up to 15 products)
  • Newsletter integration
  • Automated backups
  • Security plugin
  • Google analytics
  • Domain & Hosting
  • Custom User Manual
  • One month email & skype support
  • Duplicate Widget
  • Save Widget
  • Remove Widget
I'm ready!
Let's get started!

What to expect when we work together

There are four main stages in the website process.

Discovery (1 week)

With a simple questionnaire and strategy call, we’ll uncover what makes your business special. Understanding your business and dream client, allows me to design a site that's the perfect fit for your needs and goals.

Design (1-2 weeks)

Start on the design! This may involve wireframes (line drawings) or mock-ups depending on your project. You'll get to review the work so far and any tweaks or feedback will be incorporated before we move onto the next phase.

Development (1-2 weeks)

Coding! I'll get your website set up, looking awesome and ready for viewing. You'll get to check out your new website on my development server to give any last minute feedback before we finalise the project. 

Launch (1 week)

Go time! I'll transfer your website from my staging server to your live domain and provide you with a farewell package, containing all the important details you'll need moving forward.

 

  • Duplicate Widget
  • Save Widget
  • Remove Widget
Let's do this!

"Jessica is professional, punctual and quick. She totally understood my needs and made it possible to have a clear, clean and functional website. I highly and wholeheartedly recommend her to anyone."

Guundie Kuchling | Author and Artist

  • Duplicate Widget
  • Save Widget
  • Remove Widget

"I had several problems with my old site, the payment system had broken down, which had caused me months of worry and confusion. But Jess fixed all the problems within a few hours (did I mention that she is super efficient and professional?)."

Jane Genovese | Learning Fundamentals

  • Duplicate Widget
  • Save Widget
  • Remove Widget
  • Duplicate Widget
  • Save Widget
  • Remove Widget

Frequently Asked Questions

  • Duplicate Widget
  • Save Widget
  • Remove Widget
HOW LONG WILL MY WEBSITE TAKE?

A typical website takes 4-6 weeks from start to finish. Of course, your timeline will depend on how prepared you are and how quickly you're able to respond at each stage. 

WHAT IF NEED SOMETHING DIFFERENT TO WHAT'S LISTED IN THE PACKAGES?

Great! I love different and am happy to provide a custom quote for additional services you may need like booking systems, membership sites etc.

Just fill out the New Project Form and tell me what you’re looking for.

How do I pay?

When you accept my proposal you’ll receive an invoice for a 50% deposit (non-refundable). This secures your booking with me and can be easily paid online with any major credit card.

The balance payment is due when you approve the website, just before going live. 

WHAT DO YOU BUILD THE WEBSITE ON?

My websites are predominately built on the most popular content management system in the world, WordPress. I choose to work with WordPress over other common platforms for it’s power, flexibility and robustness. 

Depending on your project and needs, I may custom code pages or use the Elementor Pro page builder.

DO YOU HOST THE WEBSITES YOU DESIGN?

No, I don't host the websites myself. If your package includes hosting (or you add it to your package) I will set up your domain and web hosting for you with one of my preferred providers.

Otherwise, you’ll need to purchase a domain and hosting prior to the project starting. 

I JUST NEED HELP WITH MY EXISTING WEBSITE

No problem! If you've got a website you’re mostly happy with, but need some help with fixes or changes I can help with that too. 

Just fill out my Support Form and I can prepare a quote based on my hourly rate.

  • Duplicate Widget
  • Save Widget
  • Remove Widget
Take me to your Hire Me form

Still on the fence?

No problem!

You can check out some of the work in my portfolio. 

You can see why I'm the right designer for you on my about page.

Or just be social and say hi on facebook, twitter or instagram!

item.title: care plans
item.dc:creator: jessbudd
item.content:encoded:
Website Care Plans

  • Duplicate Widget
  • Save Widget
  • Remove Widget

Keep your website safe, secure and successful.

You've invested a lot in your website - don't let all that great work be undone by not having a regular maintenance plan in place.

A website is like a car. It needs regular care and maintenance to keep everything running smoothly.

Technology changes so quickly, including the software used to build and house your website files. This means your plugins, themes and core need regular updates to keep your site safe. Not to mention ensuring regular security scans and backups in the case of any nasties getting through.

If all that work sounds overwhelming, don't worry. I can take care of it all for you.

 

  • Duplicate Widget
  • Save Widget
  • Remove Widget
View Care Plans

 Less time. Less Worry. Less Effort.

Worrying about the technical upkeep of your website is probably not high on your priority list. You’re busy growing your business and getting things done. But a website that’s out of date, infected by viruses, or down completely means you’re left with…

  • No Traffic
  • No Customers
  • No Sales

That's why you should let a professional keep your website running smoothly. I’ll handle any issues for you, so you don’t have to lift a finger.

Goodbye website stress, hello peace of mind!

 

Website Care Plans

**Introductory 10% offer expires at midnight Monday 14th August** 

  • Duplicate Widget
  • Save Widget
  • Remove Widget
  • Duplicate Widget
  • Save Widget
  • Remove Widget

Essentials Care

$55 $ 49 p/m
  • Plugin updates
  • Theme updates
  • Core updates
  • Monthly security scans
  • Manual compatibility checks
  • Secure offsite backups (weekly)
  • 2 hours website support and content changes
  • Duplicate Widget
  • Save Widget
  • Remove Widget
  • Duplicate Widget
  • Save Widget
  • Remove Widget

VIP Care

$121 $ 109 p/m
  • Plugin updates
  • Theme updates
  • Core updates
  • Real time security monitoring
  • Manual compatibility checks
  • Secure offsite backups (daily)
  • 2 hours website support and content changes

**Introductory 10% offer expires at midnight Monday 14th August**

  • Duplicate Widget
  • Save Widget
  • Remove Widget
Choose your care plan
  • Duplicate Widget
  • Save Widget
  • Remove Widget

Frequently Asked Questions

  • Duplicate Widget
  • Save Widget
  • Remove Widget
Will I be locked into a contract?

Nope! I offer a monthly service that can be cancelled at any time.

Will VIP customers be given priority?

Yes, clients that sign up to the VIP care plan will be given priority for their support.

This means I will endeavour to complete support tasks within 48 hours. 

What can I use my 2 hours of support for?

You can use your 2 hours of monthly support for a range of things, including:

  • Content changes and updates (for example adding new testimonials, updating contact details, updating product pricing, adding images to galleries)
  • Small design changes (for example changing the colour of buttons)
  • Adding small features like a newsletter sign up form
  • Simple troubleshooting (for example you can't figure out why your images won't line up right)
  • Training on how to use a plugin or advice on the best options for your website.

Of course anything that would take more than 2 hours will require a separate quote.

How are payments made?

You will have the choice of two payment options:

  1. Set up a direct debit from your credit card or bank account so you never have to think about it again!
  2. Receive an invoice each month that you can pay online with a credit card or by direct transfer.
Can I pay annually instead of monthly?

Yes, if you would prefer to pay annually, you are welcome to do so.

What happens to unused support hours?

Support hours do not officially roll over to the next month, though may be taken into account at my discretion.

Get your website maintenance sorted.

Just complete this short form to have your website your maintenance hassles taken care of.

item.title: FAQS
item.dc:creator: jessbudd
item.content:encoded:
• Edit Widget
  • Duplicate Widget
  • Save Widget
  • Remove Widget

Frequently Asked Questions

  • Edit Widget
  • Duplicate Widget
  • Save Widget
  • Remove Widget
HOW LONG WILL MY WEBSITE TAKE?

A typical website takes 4-6 weeks from start to finish. Of course, your timeline will depend on how prepared you are and how quickly you’re able to respond at each stage. 

HOW MUCH WILL MY WEBSITE COST?

Bespoke custom solutions start from $3,000, however we also offer a range of standard packages which caters for the most common entrepreneur needs. 

WHAT IF I NEED SOMETHING DIFFERENT TO WHAT'S LISTED IN THE PACKAGES?

Great! We love different and are happy to provide a custom quote for additional services you may need like booking systems, membership sites etc.

Just fill out the New Project Form and tell us what you’re looking for.

How do I pay?

When you accept our proposal you’ll receive an invoice for a 50% (non-refundable) deposit which secures your booking in our schedule. This can be easily paid online with any major credit card (or by direct deposit for Australian clients).

The balance payment is due when you approve the website, just before going live. 

WHAT DO YOU BUILD My WEBSITE WITH?

Our websites are predominately built on the most popular content management system in the world, WordPress. We choose to work with WordPress over other common platforms for it’s power, flexibility and robustness. 

Depending on your project and needs, we may custom code pages or use the Elementor Pro page builder.

DO YOU HOST MY WEBSITE?

If your package includes hosting (or you add it to your package) we will set up and organise everything for you. 

If your package does not include hosting and you haven’t added it on, you’ll need to purchase a domain and hosting prior to the project starting. 

I JUST NEED HELP WITH MY EXISTING WEBSITE

No problem! If you’ve got a website you’re mostly happy with, but need some help with fixes or changes we can help with that too. 

Just fill out our Support Form and we can prepare a quote for you.

  • Edit Widget
  • Duplicate Widget
  • Save Widget
  • Remove Widget
Let's work together

item.title: Firefly Web Design Home
item.dc:creator: jessbudd
item.content:encoded:
Professional websites for creative entrepreneurs and small business.

Reach your goals online with a web design tailored to your business and your needs.

Start Your Project

Need a website as bold and amazing as you?

We build professional websites for businesses who want beautiful, tailored sites that deliver results. 

You've built an incredible business with clients you love. The only thing you're missing now, is a website you love. 

Who knew creating an effective, high converting website wasn't as easy as just installing a pre-made theme or adding some text and images to a page? Turns out there's a whole lot more to it than that.

Is it really worth wasting 40+ hours of your valuable time trying to figure out the ins and outs of web design? Or would you rather relax, knowing that a professional is creating the magic for you?

Take back your precious time and check "sort out my website" off your To Do list, once and for all.

Find Out More

"Jess is brilliant at what she does! She took my boring, old, outdated website and completely transformed it. We were in communication throughout the whole process and there were no nasty surprises at the end - just a site that I am totally happy with!"

Jane | Learning Fundamentals

"Jess is very professional and extremely easy to work with. She went above and beyond her duties while working on my website and made the entire process extremely easy for me. The level of service and product is outstanding. Thanks Jess!!"

Kate | Health & wellness Coach

More Testimonials

It's time for a website that takes your business to the next level.

work with us

item.title: Portfolio
item.dc:creator: jessbudd
item.content:encoded:
Recent work

"Jess designed my website and has done a tremendous job on showcasing my work. She went out of her way to find what I wanted. Excellent communication and extremely happy with her work!"

Renae | Perth's Pink Painter

"Jess is brilliant at what she does! She took my boring, old, outdated site and completely transformed it. There were no nasty surprises at the end - just a site that I am totally happy with!"

item.title: Work with us
item.dc:creator: jessbudd
item.content:encoded:
Get the website you deserve

Are you ready to level up your online presence?

Does this sound familiar...

  • You've spent months searching for the perfect WordPress theme, but still can't find exactly what you want?
  • You're wasting precious hours googling and youtubing tutorials to make simple changes to your site?
  • The thought of sending your dream client to your current website kind of makes you want to cringe?

It doesn't have to be like that.

There is a better way.

You CAN be super excited to show off your website.

You CAN stop stressing and get on with what you do best (your business!).

You CAN have that amazing vision from your head turned into reality.

That's what I'm here for.

A professional website shows you are a professional.

You're not just an entrepreneur. You're a creative business #boss that's worth investing in.

Show your clients you're the real deal, with a custom website that screams your products and services are worth it. Get more clients chasing YOU with a website tailored to convert visitors into customers.

Let us melt away that frustration you've been feeling and take care of building your online home.

 

Submit New project enquiry

"Jess is very easy to work with, always happy to answer questions and talk you through options as well as the how to once the website was set up. Responds quickly to emails, very well priced, and we are super stoked with our finished product!"

Cassie | Pinjarra Football & Netball Club

"Jess updated my website’s look and has done a fantastic job, communicated very well and worked quickly to deliver great results. My views are up, the feedback is great and my bounce rate decreased from 64% to 7%!”

Alison | Lorelei Jayne

What to expect when we work together

There are four main stages in the website process.

Discovery (1 week)

With a questionnaire and strategy call, we’ll uncover what makes your business special. Understanding your business and dream client, allows us to design a site that's the perfect fit for your needs and goals.

Design (2 weeks)

Start on the design! This is a collaborative process and will usually involves wireframes (line drawings), style tiles and mock-ups, depending on your project. You'll get to provide feedback at each stage before moving on to development.

Development (2 weeks)

Coding! We''ll get your website set up, looking awesome and ready for viewing. You'll get to check out your new website on our development server to give any last minute feedback before we finalise the project. 

Launch (1 week)

Go time! We'll transfer your website from our staging server to your live domain, provide you with training material and a launch package, containing all the important details you'll need moving forward. You will also be invited to sign up for a website care plan to help support you moving forward with your website.

I'm ready, let's do this

"Jessica is professional, punctual and quick. She totally understood my needs and made it possible to have a clear, clean and functional website. I highly and wholeheartedly recommend her to anyone."

Guundie | Author and Artist

"I had several problems with my old site, the payment system had broken down, which had caused me months of worry and confusion. But Jess fixed all the problems within a few hours (did I mention that she is super efficient and professional?)."

Jane | Learning Fundamentals

Frequently Asked Questions

HOW LONG WILL MY WEBSITE TAKE?

A typical website takes around 6 weeks from start to finish. Of course, your timeline will depend on how prepared you are and how quickly you’re able to respond at each stage. 

HOW MUCH WILL MY WEBSITE COST?

Bespoke custom solutions start from $3,000, however we also offer a range of standard packages which caters for the most common entrepreneur needs. 

What are the payment options?

We accept major credit cards which can easily be paid online and offer direct deposit for our Australian clients.

When you accept our proposal you’ll receive an invoice for a 50% (non-refundable) deposit which secures your booking in our schedule. The balance payment is due when you approve the website, just before going live. 

WHAT DO YOU BUILD My WEBSITE WITH?

Our websites are predominately built on the most popular content management system in the world, WordPress. We choose to work with WordPress over other common platforms for it’s power, flexibility and robustness. 

Depending on your project and needs, we may custom code pages or use the Elementor Pro page builder.

DO YOU HOST MY WEBSITE?

If your package includes hosting (or you add it to your package) we will set up and organise everything for you. 

If your package does not include hosting and you haven’t added it on, you’ll need to purchase a domain and hosting prior to the project starting. We can recommend our preferred providers to you.

I JUST NEED HELP WITH MY EXISTING WEBSITE

No problem! If you’ve got a website you’re mostly happy with, but need some help with fixes or changes we can help with that too. 

Just fill out our Support Form and we can prepare a quote for you.

Let's work together

Still on the fence?

No problem!

You can check out some of our work in our portfolio. 

You can see why we are the right designer for you on our about page.

Or just be social and say hi on facebook, twitter or instagram!

item.title: About
item.dc:creator: jessbudd
item.content:encoded:
About Firefly Web Design

If you're reading this, it's clear you're passionate about your business and are ready to level up your online presence.

People need to see the amazing business you've built, and with over 320 million internet users worldwide, there's no better time to connect with potential customers online.

There's only one problem.

DIY web design can be time consuming, frustrating, or just plain "meh" looking. How are you supposed to create a gorgeous site that converts sales when you're already wearing so many hats?

That's where we come in.

Firefly Web Design are a small creative team that help business owners reclaim their time and master their online presence with professional, custom websites.

We're based in sunny Perth Australia, but thanks to the wonders of technology, are lucky to work with people from all over the globe!

We craft websites you can be proud of and empower you to feel confident, knowing your website is working hard for you 24/7. We've reduced client bounce rates by more than half and significantly increased other's online engagement.

Whether you're a public speaker, photographer, coach or maker we can help you reach your goals online.

[ Jessica Budd: Founder ]

Are you ready to transform your website?

Head over and complete the New Project Form to see if we're a good fit.

New Project form

item.title: Detailed Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: jessbudd
item.content:encoded:
Detailed Privacy Policy of www.fireflywebdesign.co

Types of Data collected

Among the types of Personal Data that this Application collects, by itself or through third parties, there are: Cookies, Usage Data, first name, last name, phone number, email address and website. Other Personal Data collected may be described in other sections of this privacy policy or by dedicated explanation text contextually with the Data collection. The Personal Data may be freely provided by the User, or collected automatically when using this Application. Any use of Cookies - or of other tracking tools - by this Application or by the owners of third party services used by this Application, unless stated otherwise, serves to identify Users and remember their preferences, for the sole purpose of providing the service required by the User. Failure to provide certain Personal Data may make it impossible for this Application to provide its services. Users are responsible for any Personal Data of third parties obtained, published or shared through this Application and confirm that they have the third party's consent to provide the Data to the Owner.

Mode and place of processing the Data

Methods of processing

The Data Controller processes the Data of Users in a proper manner and shall take appropriate security measures to prevent unauthorized access, disclosure, modification, or unauthorized destruction of the Data. The Data processing is carried out using computers and/or IT enabled tools, following organizational procedures and modes strictly related to the purposes indicated. In addition to the Data Controller, in some cases, the Data may be accessible to certain types of persons in charge, involved with the operation of the site (administration, sales, marketing, legal, system administration) or external parties (such as third party technical service providers, mail carriers, hosting providers, IT companies, communications agencies) appointed, if necessary, as Data Processors by the Owner. The updated list of these parties may be requested from the Data Controller at any time.

Place

The Data is processed at the Data Controller's operating offices and in any other places where the parties involved with the processing are located. For further information, please contact the Data Controller.

Retention time

The Data is kept for the time necessary to provide the service requested by the User, or stated by the purposes outlined in this document, and the User can always request that the Data Controller suspend or remove the data.

The use of the collected Data

The Data concerning the User is collected to allow the Owner to provide its services, as well as for the following purposes: Analytics, Contacting the User, Content commenting, Interaction with external social networks and platforms, Displaying content from external platforms, Interaction with data collection platforms and other third parties and SPAM protection. The Personal Data used for each purpose is outlined in the specific sections of this document.

Detailed information on the processing of Personal Data

Personal Data is collected for the following purposes and using the following services:

Analytics

The services contained in this section enable the Owner to monitor and analyze web traffic and can be used to keep track of User behavior.
Google Analytics (Google Inc.)
Google Analytics is a web analysis service provided by Google Inc. (“Google”). Google utilizes the Data collected to track and examine the use of this Application, to prepare reports on its activities and share them with other Google services. Google may use the Data collected to contextualize and personalize the ads of its own advertising network. Personal Data collected: Cookies and Usage Data. Place of processing: US – Privacy Policy – Opt Out
Display Advertising extension for Google Analytics (Google Inc.)
Google Analytics on this Application might use Google's Interest-based advertising, 3rd-party audience data and information from the DoubleClick Cookie to extend analytics with demographics, interests and ads interaction data. Personal Data collected: Cookies and Usage Data. Place of processing: US – Privacy Policy – Opt Out

Contacting the User

Contact form (This Application)
By filling in the contact form with their Data, the User authorizes this Application to use these details to reply to requests for information, quotes or any other kind of request as indicated by the form’s header. Personal Data collected: email address, first name, last name and phone number.
Mailing list or newsletter (This Application)
By registering on the mailing list or for the newsletter, the User’s email address will be added to the contact list of those who may receive email messages containing information of commercial or promotional nature concerning this Application. Your email address might also be added to this list as a result of signing up to this Application or after making a purchase. Personal Data collected: email address, first name and last name.
Phone contact (This Application)
Users that provided their phone number might be contacted for commercial or promotional purposes related to this Application, as well as for fulfilling support requests. Personal Data collected: phone number.

Content Commenting

Content commenting services allow Users to make and publish their comments on the contents of this Application. Depending on the settings chosen by the Owner, Users may also leave anonymous comments. If there is an email address among the Personal Data provided by the User, it may be used to send notifications of comments on the same content. Users are responsible for the content of their own comments. If a content commenting service provided by third parties is installed, it may still collect web traffic data for the pages where the comment service is installed, even when Users do not use the content commenting service.
Comment system managed directly (This Application)
This Application has its own internal content comment system. Personal Data collected: email address, first name, last name and website.

Displaying content from external platforms

This type of service allows you to view content hosted on external platforms directly from the pages of this Application and interact with them. This type of service might still collect web traffic data for the pages where the service is installed, even when Users do not use it.
Google Fonts (Google Inc.)
Google Fonts is a typeface visualization service provided by Google Inc. that allows this Application to incorporate content of this kind on its pages. Personal Data collected: Usage Data and various types of Data as specified in the privacy policy of the service. Place of processing: US – Privacy Policy
Gravatar (Automattic Inc.)
Gravatar is an image visualization service provided by Automattic Inc. that allows this Application to incorporate content of this kind on its pages. Please note that if Gravatar images are used for comment forms, the commenter's email address or parts of it may be sent to Gravatar - even if the commenter has not signed up for that service. Personal Data collected: email address and Usage Data. Place of processing: US – Privacy Policy

Interaction with data collection platforms and other third parties

This type of service allows Users to interact with data collection platforms or other services directly from the pages of this Application for the purpose of saving and reusing data. If one of these services is installed, it may collect browsing and Usage Data in the pages where it is installed, even if the Users do not actively use the service.
Typeform widget (TYPEFORM S.L)
The Typeform widget is a service for interacting with the Typeform data collection platform provided by TYPEFORM S.L. Personal Data collected: Cookies, email address, first name and last name. Place of processing: Spain – Privacy Policy

Interaction with external social networks and platforms

This type of service allows interaction with social networks or other external platforms directly from the pages of this Application. The interaction and information obtained through this Application are always subject to the User’s privacy settings for each social network. This type of service might still collect traffic data for the pages where the service is installed, even when Users do not use it.
Pinterest “Pin it” button and social widgets (Pinterest)
The Pinterest “Pin it” button and social widgets are services allowing interaction with the Pinterest platform provided by Pinterest Inc. Personal Data collected: Cookies and Usage Data. Place of processing: US – Privacy Policy

SPAM protection

This type of service analyzes the traffic of this Application, potentially containing Users' Personal Data, with the purpose of filtering it from parts of traffic, messages and content that are recognized as SPAM.
Akismet (Automattic Inc.)
Akismet is a SPAM protection service provided by Automattic Inc. Personal Data collected: various types of Data as specified in the privacy policy of the service. Place of processing: US – Privacy Policy
Google reCAPTCHA (Google Inc.)
Google reCAPTCHA is a SPAM protection service provided by Google Inc. Personal Data collected: Cookies and Usage Data. Place of processing: US – Privacy Policy

Further information about Personal Data

The Service is not directed to children under the age of 13

Users declare themselves to be an adult according to their applicable legislation. Minors may use this Application only with the assistance of a parent or guardian. Under no circumstance, persons under the age of 13 may use this Application.

Cookie Policy

This Application uses Cookies. To learn more and for a detailed cookie notice, you may consult the Cookie Policy.

Additional information about Data collection and processing

Legal action

The User's Personal Data may be used for legal purposes by the Data Controller, in Court or in the stages leading to possible legal action arising from improper use of this Application or the related services. The User declares to be aware that the Data Controller may be required to reveal personal data upon request of public authorities.

Additional information about User's Personal Data

In addition to the information contained in this privacy policy, this Application may provide the User with additional and contextual information concerning particular services or the collection and processing of Personal Data upon request.

System logs and maintenance

For operation and maintenance purposes, this Application and any third party services may collect files that record interaction with this Application (System logs) or use for this purpose other Personal Data (such as IP Address).

Information not contained in this policy

More details concerning the collection or processing of Personal Data may be requested from the Data Controller at any time. Please see the contact information at the beginning of this document.

The rights of Users

Users have the right, at any time, to know whether their Personal Data has been stored and can consult the Data Controller to learn about their contents and origin, to verify their accuracy or to ask for them to be supplemented, cancelled, updated or corrected, or for their transformation into anonymous format or to block any data held in violation of the law, as well as to oppose their treatment for any and all legitimate reasons. Requests should be sent to the Data Controller at the contact information set out above. This Application does not support “Do Not Track” requests. To determine whether any of the third party services it uses honour the “Do Not Track” requests, please read their privacy policies.

Changes to this privacy policy

The Data Controller reserves the right to make changes to this privacy policy at any time by giving notice to its Users on this page. It is strongly recommended to check this page often, referring to the date of the last modification listed at the bottom. If a User objects to any of the changes to the Policy, the User must cease using this Application and can request that the Data Controller remove the Personal Data. Unless stated otherwise, the then-current privacy policy applies to all Personal Data the Data Controller has about Users.

Information about this privacy policy

The Data Controller is responsible for this privacy policy, prepared starting from the modules provided by Iubenda and hosted on Iubenda's servers.

Data Controller and Owner

Firefly Web Design PO Box 54 Thornlie WA 6988 (Australia) Owner contact email: hello@fireflywebdesign.co

item.title: Cookie Policy
item.dc:creator: jessbudd
item.content:encoded:
Extended Cookie Policy

Cookies consist of portions of code installed in the browser that assist the Owner in providing the service according to the purposes described. Some of the purposes for which the Cookies are installed may also require the User's consent.

Technical Cookies and Cookies serving aggregated statistical purposes

  • Activity strictly necessary for the functioning of the service

    This Application uses Cookies to save the User's session and to carry out other activities that are strictly necessary for the operation of the same, for example in relation to the distribution of traffic.

  • Activity regarding the saving of preferences, optimization, and statistics

    This Application uses Cookies to save browsing preferences and to optimize the User's browsing experience. Among these Cookies are, for example, those to set the language and the currency or for the management of first party statistics employed directly by the Owner of the site.

Other types of Cookies or third-party tools that might use them

Some of the services listed below collect statistics in aggregated form and may not require the consent of the User or may be managed directly by the Owner - depending on how they are described - without the help of third parties. If any third party operated services are listed among the tools below, these may be used to track Users’ browsing habits – in addition to the information specified herein and without the Owner’s knowledge. Please refer to the privacy policy of the listed services for detailed information.

  • Analytics

    The services contained in this section enable the Owner to monitor and analyze web traffic and can be used to keep track of User behavior.

    Google Analytics (Google Inc.)

    Google Analytics is a web analysis service provided by Google Inc. (“Google”). Google utilizes the Data collected to track and examine the use of this Application, to prepare reports on its activities and share them with other Google services. Google may use the Data collected to contextualize and personalize the ads of its own advertising network. Personal Data collected: Cookies and Usage Data. Place of processing: US – Privacy Policy – Opt Out

    Display Advertising extension for Google Analytics (Google Inc.)

    Google Analytics on this Application might use Google's Interest-based advertising, 3rd-party audience data and information from the DoubleClick Cookie to extend analytics with demographics, interests and ads interaction data. Personal Data collected: Cookies and Usage Data. Place of processing: US – Privacy Policy – Opt Out

  • Interaction with data collection platforms and other third parties

    This type of service allows Users to interact with data collection platforms or other services directly from the pages of this Application for the purpose of saving and reusing data. If one of these services is installed, it may collect browsing and Usage Data in the pages where it is installed, even if the Users do not actively use the service.

    Typeform widget (TYPEFORM S.L)

    The Typeform widget is a service for interacting with the Typeform data collection platform provided by TYPEFORM S.L. Personal Data collected: Cookies, email address, first name and last name. Place of processing: Spain – Privacy Policy

  • Interaction with external social networks and platforms

    This type of service allows interaction with social networks or other external platforms directly from the pages of this Application. The interaction and information obtained through this Application are always subject to the User’s privacy settings for each social network. This type of service might still collect traffic data for the pages where the service is installed, even when Users do not use it.

    Pinterest “Pin it” button and social widgets (Pinterest)

    The Pinterest “Pin it” button and social widgets are services allowing interaction with the Pinterest platform provided by Pinterest Inc. Personal Data collected: Cookies and Usage Data. Place of processing: US – Privacy Policy

  • SPAM protection

    This type of service analyzes the traffic of this Application, potentially containing Users' Personal Data, with the purpose of filtering it from parts of traffic, messages and content that are recognized as SPAM.

    Google reCAPTCHA (Google Inc.)

    Google reCAPTCHA is a SPAM protection service provided by Google Inc. Personal Data collected: Cookies and Usage Data. Place of processing: US – Privacy Policy

How can I manage the installation of Cookies?

In addition to what is specified in this document, the User can manage preferences for Cookies directly from within their own browser and prevent – for example – third parties from installing them. Through the browser preferences, it is also possible to delete Cookies installed in the past, including the Cookies that might possibly have saved the consent for the installation of Cookies by this website. It is important to note that by disabling all Cookies, the functioning of this site may be compromised. Users can find information about how to manage Cookies in their browser at the following addresses: Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, Apple Safari and Microsoft Windows Explorer. In the case of services provided by third parties, Users can exercise their right to withdraw from the tracking activity by utilizing the information provided in the third party’s privacy policy, by clicking the opt-out link – if provided – or by contacting the third party. Notwithstanding the above, the Owner informs that Users may take advantage of: Your Online Choices. This service allows Users to select their tracking preferences for most of the advertising tools. The Owner thus recommends that Users make use of this resource in addition to the information provided in this document.

Data Controller and Owner

Firefly Web Design PO Box 54 Thornlie WA 6988 (Australia) Owner contact email: info@fireflywebdesign.com.au Since the installation of third party Cookies and other tracking systems through the services used within this Application cannot be technically controlled by the Owner, any specific references to Cookies and tracking systems installed by third parties are to be considered indicative. In order to obtain complete information, consult the privacy policy for the respective third party services listed in this document. Given the objective complexity linked to the identification of technologies based on Cookies and their very close integration with the operation of the web, Users are encouraged to contact the Owner should they wish to receive any further information on the use of Cookies themselves and any possible use of them - for example, by a third party - carried out through this site.

Definitions and legal references

Personal Data (or Data)

Any information regarding a natural person, a legal person, an institution or an association, which is, or can be, identified, even indirectly, by reference to any other information, including a personal identification number.

Usage Data

Information collected automatically from this Application (or third party services employed in this Application), which can include: the IP addresses or domain names of the computers utilized by the Users who use this Application, the URI addresses (Uniform Resource Identifier), the time of the request, the method utilized to submit the request to the server, the size of the file received in response, the numerical code indicating the status of the server's answer (successful outcome, error, etc.), the country of origin, the features of the browser and the operating system utilized by the User, the various time details per visit (e.g., the time spent on each page within the Application) and the details about the path followed within the Application with special reference to the sequence of pages visited, and other parameters about the device operating system and/or the User's IT environment.

User

The individual using this Application, which must coincide with or be authorized by the Data Subject, to whom the Personal Data refers.

Data Subject

The legal or natural person to whom the Personal Data refers.

Data Processor (or Data Supervisor)

The natural person, legal person, public administration or any other body, association or organization authorized by the Data Controller to process the Personal Data in compliance with this privacy policy.

Data Controller (or Owner)

The natural person, legal person, public administration or any other body, association or organization with the right, also jointly with another Data Controller, to make decisions regarding the purposes, and the methods of processing of Personal Data and the means used, including the security measures concerning the operation and use of this Application. The Data Controller, unless otherwise specified, is the Owner of this Application.

This Application

The hardware or software tool by which the Personal Data of the User is collected.

Cookies

Small piece of data stored in the User's device.

Legal information

Notice to European Users: this privacy statement has been prepared in fulfillment of the obligations under Art. 10 of EC Directive n. 95/46/EC, and under the provisions of Directive 2002/58/EC, as revised by Directive 2009/136/EC, on the subject of Cookies.
[Updated: June 2017]

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: jessbudd
item.content:encoded:
FIREFLY WEB DESIGN WEBSITE PRIVACY POLICY

  BY VISITING WWW.FIREFLYWEBDESIGN.CO, YOU ARE CONSENTING TO OUR PRIVACY POLICY

OVERVIEW

Firefly Web Design (“Company”) is committed to protecting your privacy online.  Company complies with the PRIVACY ACT 1988 ("Privacy Act") and the included provisions to protect the personal information of its customers. Personal information includes any information about an identifiable individual, such as name, address, gender, age, ID numbers, and other things. By providing Company with your personal information, you consent to its collection, use and disclosure by us in accordance with the terms of this Website Privacy Policy (the “Policy”). This Policy describes the personal information we collect, use and disclose through this website at www.fireflywebdesign.co (the “Site”). Visitors to and users of the site are referred to as “user”, “you” and “your” and Company is referred to as “we”, “us”, and “our”. On the Site, we provide information about web design and development, and a blog (the “Service”). Use of the Site, including all materials presented herein and all online Services provided by Company, is subject to this Policy.  This Policy applies to all site visitors, customers and all other users of the Site. Accessing this Site constitutes a use of the Site and a full acceptance of this Policy and its terms. WHAT INFORMATION DO WE COLLECT? This Site only collects the personal information you voluntarily provide to us, which includes your name and e-mail address, in order to subscribe to our newsletter or comment on our blog. When you visit our website, we also collect: information about your computer, including your IP address, the type of operating system and browser you use, and your computer’s location, what pages you visit on our site and what links you click on.  If you opt-in to receive our newsletter, the option to unsubscribe will be included in every e-mail. We may share your information with trusted third parties who provide support in running this website including any blog or newsletter.  All parties will keep your information confidential and will never be shared with unrelated third parties. We may record information relating to your use of the Site in order to help administer the Site and personalise your experience by improving customer service. Additionally, we may send cookies (not the tasty kind) to your computer in order to identify your improve our service.  At any point, you may decline the cookies in your Internet settings.  However, doing so may prevent use of some of the Site. HOW DO WE USE THE INFORMATION WE COLLECT? We may use it to deliver content and products that you are most interested in. We use it to serve you better and respond to customer service requests, to run contests or promotions, send surveys or e-mail newsletters.  We do not use your personal information for purposes other than those for which it was originally collected unless we first obtain your consent to do so. HOW CAN I OPT-OUT? Please let us know if you do not wish to receive correspondence from us by clicking on the ‘unsubscribe’ link in our newsletter emails, or by emailing hello{at}fireflywebdesign.co. HOW DO YOU PROTECT MY INFORMATION? We do our best to protect your information from any unauthorised access, misuse, or disclosure and we use a variety of security measures to keep it safe, including secure networks and limited access to your information.  However, you understand that personal information you voluntarily share online, on any website, could be accessed or tampered with by a third party.  You agree that we are not responsible for any intercepted information shared through our Site without our knowledge or permission.  Additionally, you release us from any and all claims arising out of or related to the use of such intercepted information in any unauthorized manner.  You agree to notify us for any breach of security or unauthorized use of your information. Your personal information is only accessible by those who need to access it to provide you Service and use it in the ways described in this Policy. We use PayPal to process online orders, so we do not directly collect financial or payment information from you. WHO DO WE DISCLOSE YOUR INFORMATION TO? We limit disclose of your information to disclosure as required to in order to comply with the law, to protect our rights or the rights of others, or to enforce our policies. HOW LONG DO WE RETAIN YOUR INFORMATION? Only for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected, as outlined in this Website Privacy Policy. LINKS We may have third party links on our Site. These websites have separate privacy policies so please be aware and review the privacy policy of any other site you visit. You acknowledge and accept that we are not responsible for the privacy policies or practices of third parties. CHANGES Our Privacy Policy may change from time to time; if changes are made they will be posted here. You acknowledge and agree that you have reviewed this Policy and will continue to review the Site to be aware of any modifications. This policy was most recently modified on October 5, 2015. CONTACT If you have any questions about our privacy policy or need any other information please contact our privacy officer at hello@fireflywebdesign.co. Firefly Web Design PO Box 54, Thornlie WA 6988 Australia We welcome your questions, comments and concerns. Please also review our website Terms and Conditions www.fireflywebdesign.co/terms-conditions which govern your use of our Site. A more detailed version of this privacy policy can be found at www.fireflywebdesign.co/privacy-detailed.

item.title: Website Care Plans
item.dc:creator: jessbudd
item.content:encoded:
Website Care Plans

Keep your website safe, secure and successful.

You've invested a lot in your website - don't let all that great work be undone by not having a regular maintenance plan in place.

A website is like a car. It needs regular care and maintenance to keep everything running smoothly.

Technology changes so quickly, including the software used to build and house your website files. This means your plugins, themes and core need regular updates to keep your site safe. Not to mention ensuring regular security scans and backups in the case of any nasties getting through.

If all that work sounds overwhelming, don't worry. I can take care of it all for you.

 

View Care Plans

 Less time. Less Worry. Less Effort.

Worrying about the technical upkeep of your website is probably not high on your priority list. You’re busy growing your business and getting things done. But a website that’s out of date, infected by viruses, or down completely means you’re left with…

  • No Traffic
  • No Customers
  • No Sales

That's why you should let a professional keep your website running smoothly. I’ll handle any issues for you, so you don’t have to lift a finger.

Goodbye website stress, hello peace of mind!

 

Website Care Plans

**Introductory 10% offer expires at midnight Monday 14th August** 

Essentials Care

$55 $ 49 /mo
  • Plugin updates
  • Theme updates
  • Core updates
  • Monthly security scans
  • Manual compatibility checks
  • Secure offsite backups (weekly)
  • 2 hours website support and content changes

VIP Care

$121 $ 109 /mo
  • Plugin updates
  • Theme updates
  • Core updates
  • Real time security monitoring
  • Manual compatibility checks
  • Secure offsite backups (daily)
  • 2 hours website support and content changes

**Introductory 10% offer expires at midnight Monday 14th August**

Choose your care plan

Frequently Asked Questions

Will I be locked into a contract?

Nope! I offer a monthly service that can be cancelled at any time.

Will VIP customers be given priority?

Yes, clients that sign up to the VIP care plan will be given priority for their support.

This means I will endeavour to complete support tasks within 48 hours. 

What can I use my 2 hours of support for?

You can use your 2 hours of monthly support for a range of things, including:

  • Content changes and updates (for example adding new testimonials, updating contact details, updating product pricing, adding images to galleries)
  • Small design changes (for example changing the colour of buttons)
  • Adding small features like a newsletter sign up form
  • Simple troubleshooting (for example you can't figure out why your images won't line up right)
  • Training on how to use a plugin or advice on the best options for your website.

Of course anything that would take more than 2 hours will require a separate quote.

How are payments made?

You will have the choice of two payment options:

  1. Set up a direct debit from your credit card or bank account so you never have to think about it again!
  2. Receive an invoice each month that you can pay online with a credit card or by direct transfer.
Can I pay annually instead of monthly?

Yes, if you would prefer to pay annually, you are welcome to do so. You'll even be awarded with one month free if you do!

What happens to unused support hours?

Support hours do not officially roll over to the next month, though may be taken into account at my discretion.

Get your website maintenance sorted.

Just complete this short form to have your website your maintenance hassles taken care of.

item.title: Website Care Plans
item.dc:creator: jessbudd
item.content:encoded:
Website Care Plans

Keep your website safe, secure and successful.

You've invested a lot in your website - don't let all that great work be undone by not having a regular plan in place for the necessary care, maintenance and updates.

Technology changes so quickly, including the software used to build and house your website files. This means your plugins, themes and core need regular updates to keep them working optimally. Not to mention ensuring regular security scans and backups in the case of any nasties getting through.

If all that work sounds overwhelming, don't worry. We've got your back and can take care of it all for you.

 

View Care Plans

 Less time. Less Worry. Less Effort.

Worrying about the technical upkeep of your website is probably not high on your priority list. You’re busy growing your business, smashing your goals and getting things done. But a website that’s out of date, infected by viruses, or down completely means you’re left with…

  • No Traffic
  • No Customers
  • No Sales

That's why you should let a professional keep your website running smoothly. We’ll handle any issues for you, so you don’t have to lift a finger.

Goodbye website stress, hello peace of mind!

We have three Care Plan tiers to suit your personalised website needs. 

Website Care Plans

Essentials Care

$ 69 /mo
  • Plugin updates
  • Theme updates
  • Core updates
  • Daily security scans
  • Secure daily offsite backups
  • Premium plugin licenses
  • Manual compatibility checks
  • Continued access to training dashboard
  • Google analytics reporting
  • Website support tasks
  • Content Updates

VIP Care

$ 199 /mo
  • Plugin updates
  • Theme updates
  • Core updates
  • Daily security scans
  • Secure daily offsite backups
  • Premium plugin licenses
  • Manual compatibility checks
  • Continued access to training dashboard
  • Google analytics reporting
  • 2 hours website support and content updating ($200 value)

Unlimited Care

$ 497 /mo
  • Plugin updates
  • Theme updates
  • Core updates
  • Realtime security montioring
  • Secure daily offsite backups
  • Premium plugin licenses
  • Manual compatibility checks
  • Continued access to training dashboard
  • Google analytics reporting
  • Priority support times
  • UNLIMITED small tasks and content updating (under 30 minutes each)
Choose your care plan

Frequently Asked Questions

Why do I need an ongoing care plan?

Keeping the software that runs your website up-to-date is imperative to its security, performance and stability. Having a developer/designer on call is a cost effective and time efficient solution to small business’s needs. 

 The core WordPress software, themes and plugins are created by multiple authors, and are consistently updated to newer versions to make improvements and to address security issues and bugs. Unfortunately, its not guaranteed that the mandated updates to not break the website or that plugins will continue to function if not updated.

For this reason, having an experienced web professional on hand is necessary to update plugins, rollback plugins, replace plugins or adjust the theme to continue optimal performance.

Can I cancel at any time?

Of course, you can cancel anytime. You’re not locked in or under any obligation to continue the ongoing service. We do appreciate if you give us 30 days notice so we can carry out our last thorough update of the website, supply you with a full backup and remove our administrator credentials.

What can I use my 2 hours of support for in the VIP Care Plan?

The VIP Plan comes with 2 hours of general website support. You can use these hours for a range of tasks, including:

  • Content changes and updates (for example publishing a blog post, adding new testimonials, updating contact details, updating product pricing, adding images to galleries)
  • Small design changes (for example changing the colour of buttons)
  • Adding small features like a newsletter sign up form
  • Simple troubleshooting (for example you can’t figure out why your images won’t line up right)
  • Training on how to use a plugin or advice on the best options for your website.
  • Conversion optimisation or digital marketing advice
  • Google analytics training or advice

The 2 hours can be used all at once, or in smaller chunks (time is recorded in 15 minute increments). Of course anything that would take more than 2 hours will require a separate quote.

What does "unlimited" mean in the Unlimited Care Plan?

If you sign up for the Unlimited Care Plan we will help you with an unlimited amount of small website tasks that take less than 30 minutes each.  

These could include:

  • Publishing a blog post
  • Adding new testimonials
  • Updating product pricing
  • Adding images to galleries
  • Simple troubleshooting 
  • Changing forms

It does not cover advanced features like a complete online shop or graphic design work like creating blog post feature images.

What happens to unused support hours?

Support hours do not roll over or accumulate, though may be taken into account strictly at our discretion.

Can I pay annually instead of monthly?

Yes, if you would prefer to pay annually, you are welcome to do so. Just let us know at the time of set up and we will adjust the schedule for you.

How are payments made?

Our care plans are a subscription service and are debited from your credit card monthly.

Get your website maintenance sorted.

Just complete this short form to have your website your maintenance hassles taken care of.

item.title: Packages
item.dc:creator: jessbudd
item.content:encoded:
Web Design Packages

Websites should be as individual as you are and we'd love to work with you on coming up with a custom package.

That being said, sometimes it's nice to order straight off the menu. Which is why we've created three packages you can choose from if you prefer.

Website Packages

The Starter Package

$ 1500
  • Custom WordPress design
  • Up to 5 web pages
  • Set up of blog
  • Social media integration
  • Two weeks email support
  • Training videos & documentation
  • Set up of online shop
  • Newsletter intergration
  • Google analytics
  • Domain Registration
  • Web Hosting
  • Custom user manual

The Entrepreneur Package

$ 2500
  • Custom WordPress design
  • Up to 8 web pages
  • Set up of blog
  • Social media integration
  • Setup of online shop (up to 5 products)
  • Newsletter integration
  • One month email support
  • Training videos & documentation
  • Google analytics
  • Domain Registration
  • Web Hosting
  • Custom user manual

The Pro Package

$ 3500
  • Custom WordPress design
  • Up to 12 web pages
  • Set up of blog
  • Social media integration
  • Setup of online shop (up to 15 products)
  • Newsletter integration
  • One month email & skype support
  • Training videos & documentation
  • Google analytics
  • Domain Registration (1 year)
  • Web Hosting (1 year)
  • Custom User Manual
I'm ready!
Let's get started!

Don't see what you're looking for?

No problem! Fill out our new project form with the details of what your project needs and we can prepare a custom proposal for you.

What to expect when we work together

There are four main stages in the website process.

Discovery (1 week)

With a simple questionnaire and strategy call, we’ll uncover what makes your business special. Understanding your business and dream client, allows us to design a site that's the perfect fit for your needs and goals.

Design (2 weeks)

Start on the design! This may involve style tiles, wireframes (line drawings) or mock-ups depending on your project. You'll get to review the work so far and any tweaks or feedback will be incorporated before we move onto the next phase.

Development (2 weeks)

Coding! We'll get your website set up, looking awesome and ready for viewing. You'll get to check out your new website on our development server to give any last minute feedback before we finalise the project. 

Launch (1 week)

Go time! We'll transfer your website from my staging server to your live domain, provide you with training material and a farewell package, containing all the important details you'll need moving forward. You will also be invited to sign up for a website care plan to help support you moving forward with your website.

Let's do this!

"Working with Firefly Web Design has not only given us a greater insight into our business through the business review process, but has also provided us with greater clarity around every aspect of what we offer as a service provider."

Kelly | Giraffe facilities maintenance

"Jess updated my website’s look and has done a fantastic job, communicated very well and worked quickly to deliver great results. My views are up, the feedback is great and my bounce rate decreased from 64% to 7%!”

Alison | Lorelei Jayne

Frequently Asked Questions

HOW LONG WILL MY WEBSITE TAKE?

A typical website takes around 6 weeks from start to finish. Of course, your timeline will depend on how prepared you are and how quickly you’re able to respond at each stage. 

What are my payment options?

We accept major credit cards which can easily be paid online and offer direct deposit for our Australian clients.

When you accept our proposal you’ll receive an invoice for a 50% (non-refundable) deposit which secures your booking in our schedule. The balance payment is due when you approve the website, just before going live. 

WHAT IF I NEED SOMETHING DIFFERENT TO WHAT'S LISTED IN THE PACKAGES?

Great! We love different and are happy to provide a custom quote for additional services you may need like booking systems, membership sites etc.

Just fill out the New Project Form and tell us what you’re looking for.

WHAT DO YOU BUILD My WEBSITE WITH?

Our websites are predominately built on the most popular content management system in the world, WordPress. We choose to work with WordPress over other common platforms for it’s power, flexibility and robustness. 

Depending on your project and needs, we may custom code pages or use the Elementor Pro page builder.

DO YOU HOST MY WEBSITE?

If your package includes hosting (or you add it to your package) we will set up and organise everything for you. 

If your package does not include hosting and you haven’t added it on, you’ll need to purchase a domain and hosting prior to the project starting. 

I JUST NEED HELP WITH MY EXISTING WEBSITE

No problem! If you’ve got a website you’re mostly happy with, but need some help with fixes or changes we can help with that too. 

Just fill out our Support Form and we can prepare a quote for you.

Let's work together

"Jessica is professional, punctual and quick. She totally understood my needs and made it possible to have a clear, clean and functional website. I highly and wholeheartedly recommend her to anyone."

Guundie | Author and Artist

"I've noticed a dramatic increase in the number of website visitors who have reached out to make contact with me via email.My monthly book sales have increased by approximately 30% and bookings for school talks are going strong for the new year."

Jane | Learning Fundamentals

A professional website shows you are a professional.

You're not just an entrepreneur. You're a creative business #boss that's worth investing in.

Show your clients you're the real deal, with a custom website that screams your products and services are worth it. Get more clients chasing YOU with a website tailored to convert visitors into customers.

Let us melt away that frustration you've been feeling and take care of building your online home.

Get your website sorted

Still on the fence?

No problem!

You can check out some of the work in my portfolio. 

You can see why I'm the right designer for you on my about page.

Or just be social and say hi on facebook, twitter or instagram!

item.title: WordPress Security Basics: How to Avoid Getting Hacked
item.dc:creator: jessbudd
item.content:encoded:
You've spent hours setting up your new WordPress website and you're celebrating. You're not alone. WordPress is the most popular content management system in the world, accounting for 27% of all websites. Sounds awesome! But being popular also has its drawbacks, like being a popular target for hackers. Today you're going to learn 6 simple things you can do to keep your WordPress website safer from hackers.

1. Secure Passwords

The easiest way for unauthorised users to gain access to your website is by guessing your password. So if your password is your birthday, dog or kids names (or heaven forbid “password”), you’re leaving yourself wide open. A secure password should include:
  • At least 8 characters;
  • Numbers as well as letters; and
  • A special character.
WordPress actually provides a secure password generator, so you don’t even have to think of one yourself. To use this feature, login to your Dashboard and go to Users > Your Profile. Scroll down to “Account Management” and next to “New Password”, click the “Generate Password” button. This will generate a long and secure password for you. Write this password down somewhere safe (or save it to your password manager) and then click “Update Profile” at the bottom. Done!

2. Change the Default Username

When WordPress is first installed, it creates a generic user named “admin” (unless you change the default settings). Leaving your username as “admin” gives would be hackers one half of your username/password combo. There are a few ways to change your username, but the easiest is to create a new user (with administration privileges) and then delete the “admin” user. This easily can be done through your dashboard “Users” tab.

3. Limit Login Attempts

A “brute force” attack is when a person or computer program attempts to login over and over again, trying many different username/password combinations. To combat these attacks, you can limit the number of times a person (or bot!) can attempt to login to your WordPress dashboard. There are a number plugins that do this specifically, and most general security plugins such as WordFence will have this function. (And don’t worry, you can still recover your password if you lose or forget it.)

4. Keep WordPress and Plugins Updated

The WordPress application and associated plugins are updated regularly, and although it can be annoying seeing that little red button come up so often – there is a good reason for this. Whenever a security vulnerability is discovered, the WordPress team work around the clock to release an update that closes the security loop hole. If you’re not updating WordPress and your plugins when they become available, you are leaving yourself exposed to known security risks.

5. Delete Themes and Plugins Not In Use

So you’ve downloaded 10 different themes and 20 different plugins to try out on your new website. You’ve finally found your perfect theme and the best plugins, but what did you do with the ones that weren’t the right fit? If you’re like most people, you’ve left them in your themes and plugins folders gathering dust. The more themes and plugins you have installed, the higher your risk of an unscrupulous hacker messing with your site. (Not to mention the effect of slowing down the speed of your website.) If you’re not using a plugin or theme you should deactivate and delete.

6. Backups

This tip doesn’t actually prevent you people gaining access to your site, but it is one of the most often overlooked part of a security plan. If your website is compromised and you don't have a recent clean backup, there's going to be tears! You absolutely need to ensure there are regular backups of your website ready to be restored. A simple free option I recommend is UpDraft. It is easy to use and set up automatic scheduling for your backups. It can even send the backups directly to your cloud Dropbox or Google accounts.

Conclusion

The truth is that everything on the internet is hackable (even NASA and the pentagon!). Although there are more advanced measures you can use to secure your site, taking these  6 basic precautions will make you less of a target and reduce the likelihood of discovering your website has been held ransom by malicious software.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Follow these 6 essential WordPress security tips to ensure your website has the basics covered. Don't let your website get hacked when you could take these 6 easy steps!

item.title: How To Choose a WordPress Plugin
item.dc:creator: jessbudd
item.content:encoded: Looking for a great WordPress plugin that does exactly what you want can sometimes feel like looking for a needle in a haystack. How do you know which ones to install? In this article I'll be teaching you exactly what to look for when choosing a WordPress plugin. First off, what is a WordPress plugin and why do I need one? Essentially, a plugin is a piece of software that can be added to your WordPress website to extend it's functionality or add new features. Plugins can be free or premium (paid).   first page of google Choosing a Plugin Star Rating 4-5 stars, number of reviews Active installs 10,000+ Last Updated (within the last year) Compatible with WordPress   Now that you know how to choose a WordPress plugin, you can go ahead and get cracking! If you need any guidance on how to install a WordPress plugin, check out my blog post How to Install a WordPress Plugin or my tutorial video.

item.title: How To Install a WordPress Plugin (Even If You're Not Tech Savvy)
item.dc:creator: jessbudd
item.content:encoded:
So you've got your website up and running, but there's still a few things missing. Maybe it's newsletter sign up box or a light-box gallery to showcase your portfolio. Whatever the functionality you're lacking, it's time to dive in and install a WordPress plugin to add the features you're after. I promise, it's not as daunting as you may think! For today's tutorial we will be installing a plugin to add social sharing links to this website's blog posts. (If you prefer to watch rather than read, I've also created a video at the bottom of this post just for you.) Let's begin!

1. Log in

The first step is to log in to the backend of  your WordPress website and go to your dashboard.

2. Go to Plugins

Once logged in, scroll down your left hand side bar until you find the menu item labelled "Plugins". If you hover your mouse or click on the Plugins menu item, you will see three or more sub-menu options. Click the option titled "Add New".  

3. Enter Keyword

You will be taken to the "Add Plugins" page, where on the right hand side you'll find a keyword search field. This is where you enter what type of plugin or functionality you are looking for. For example you may search for "Instagram feed" or "popular posts widget". For this tutorial we will search for the keywords "social share".  

4. Select and Install

Scroll through the plugin search results until you find a suitable plugin. I've chosen a plugin about a quarter way down the page called "Social Pug". (If you'd like a detailed post on how to choose the right plugin, check out How To Choose a WordPress Plugin. I also discuss what to look for when selecting a plugin in the video at the bottom of this post.)  Once you've found the plugin you want, click the "Install Now" button.  

5. Activate Plugin

You're plugin has now been installed, but it can't actually be used until it is "activated". After the previous step, you may have noticed that the grey "Install Now" button has been replaced with a blue "Activate" button. Click the "Activate" button now.  

6. Set Up Your Plugin

Great! Your plugin is now installed and activated, but most plugins will have just one more step which is to configure your settings. There are two common ways to access the settings of your plugin. One is through the "Plugins" page (next to "Deactivate" and "Edit"); the other is through an additional menu item on your dashboard side menu.     Some plugins will have both of these methods and others will have only one or the other. To give you an idea, here are some of the settings to be configured on the Social Pug plugin.     Once I've configured my settings and hit "save", I'm ready to view the finished product. You can see on the side of this post that I now have beautiful floating share icons. And there you have it! You now know how to successfully install a WordPress plugin and are on your way to taking control of your website.

Was installing a plugin easier or harder than you expected? I'd love to hear how you went in the comments or by email. And if there's any other topics you'd like to read and learn about, let me know!

  (Link to external video)

item.title: Blog
item.dc:creator: jessbudd

item.title: 5 Essential Plugins Your WordPress Website Needs
item.dc:creator: jessbudd
item.content:encoded:
As a WordPress designer and developer, one of the questions I get asked a lot is “What plugins do I need?”. There are so many great plugins available that it can definitely be overwhelming for a newbie or DIYer! Unfortunately, when I help clients with websites they built themselves, I often notice that they’ve missed the most important plugins every website should have. So today I just wanted to share with you the top 5 WordPress plugin types your website needs. They are:
  1. A caching plugin
  2. An SEO plugin
  3. A security plugin.
  4. A backup plugin
  5. A contact form plugin.
Let me go into each of them in a little more detail, so you can see why each of them are important.

Caching Plugin

Essentially, a caching plugin makes your website load faster by serving a saved copy of your images and files. And as we all know, speed matters! If your website is taking more than 5 seconds to load on a mobile phone, most people are going to hit the back button and probably not come back. Some good options for caching are WPRocket (paid) and W3 Total Cache (free).

SEO Plugin

An SEO plugin is a must for determining how your website shows up on google and in social media links. It also creates a sitemap for search engines and walks you through the basics that you need to know to get that all important traffic coming through. At Firefly Web Design we exclusively use Yoast SEO, however a quality alternative is SEO Framework.

Security Plugin

WordPress is the most popular content management system in the world, which is great, but also makes it a strong target for hackers. A good security plugin will regularly scan your website for malicious malware as well as protect your website from “brute force attacks”. This is a must to keep your website safe and secure. The best WordPress security plugins include Scurri and WordFence. Both of these services have free and paid options available.

Backup Plugin

Regular, secure backups are your number one defence from losing your website to hackers (or just breaking your site by accident!). A good backup plugin will allow you to automate your backups and send them to a secure location (like your dropbox or google drive account). So if anything does happen, you’ll be able to quickly and easily get your website back up and running. Some good backup plugins include UpDraft plus (free) and backup buddy (paid).

Contact Form Plugin

This is an obvious one, but WordPress doesn’t actually come with contact form functionality out of the box. This is why some people chose to list their contact details and forgo the contact form, but this is a mistake! Many visitors won’t want to call you and won’t bother opening up their email service to write to you. An easy to fill in contact form is a must. For simple free forms, Contact Form 7 or Ninja Forms will do the trick. For advanced forms with functionality like conditional questions and taking payments, you can't go past Gravity Forms. So there you have it, 5 of the must have plugin types for your WordPress website. I hope this information will help you make the most of your website!

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Do you have the 5 most essential plugins on your website? Follow this short list to ensure you're making the most of your WordPress website. Click through and see if you've got these basics!
